text.text: Select a rate category

text: To select a rate category, you can use the following steps: 1. On the navigation bar, click Settings. 2. On the Settings page, click the Charges tab. 3. Click the View field and select the category you want to delete. 4. Now, click Edit. 5. The charge category displays on the page. Click Edit again. 6. A pop-up window displays the dates for the category. Click the Delete date range button.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=lhnjkg7ojt

text.text: What is rate category?

text: A rate category is a grouping of rates for a specific purpose. For example, you can create a category for charges that differ from your universal rates. You can also create a category for charge increases.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=lhnjkg7ojt

text.text: How to bill patient for itemized charge?

text: To bill a patient for an itemized charge, you can use the following steps: 1. Click Settings on the navigation bar. 2. Click the Charges tab. 3. Check the View field and verify that you are on the right charge category. 4. If you are then click Itemize supplies.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=6bsx0y73ks

text.text: How do I Work with charge categories?

text: To work with charge categories, you can use the following steps: 1. On the navigation bar, click Settings. 2. On the Settings page, click the Charges tab. 3. Click the View field and select the charge category. 4. Click Edit. 5. Add or change rates as needed. 6. Click Save.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xz4vz0ura6

text.text: Explain working with charge categories.

text: Charge categories are groups of rates for a specific purpose. To define the charge rates on the Universal category, you can click the View field and select the Universal category. You can also add or change rates as needed. Once you create a category, your base rates will show under the Universal category.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xz4vz0ura6

text.text: How to setup RescueNet ePCR Exports for Zoll Billing?

text: To configure RescueNet ePCR to send PCR data to ZOLL Billing, you need to: 1. Configure the Web Service. 2. Select a company from the drop-down list. 3. Click the Billing Company radio button. 4. Click OK.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=ns07ankmby

text.text: How to set credentials for API management?

text: To set credentials for API management, you can follow these steps: 1. Go to Admin > NEMSIS Import > API Credentials. 2. Click the plus sign next to ' Add New API Credential ' on the upper left of the screen. 3. Read the message that displays. 4. You can see the key later on but you won't see the password again so it is very important to note the password.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=jwhldkuzpo

text.text: How to configure user for API management?

text: To configure users for API key management, you can follow these steps: 1. Log onto ZOLL Online and go to Admin > Billing > User Accounts 2. Go to the Administration roles & permissions banner and check the box next to Edit API credentials and View API credentials 3. Scroll down and find the NEMSIS import roles & permissions banner 4. Change the product access from no to yes 5. Click Save
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=jwhldkuzpo

text.text: How do I create and manage NEMSIS API credentials or API Key?

text: To create and manage NEMSIS API credentials, you can follow these steps: 1. Go to Admin > NEMSIS Import > API Credentials. 2. Click the plus sign next to ' Add New API Credential ' on the upper left of the screen. 3. Read the message that displays. 4. You can see the key later on but you won't see the password again so it is very important to note the password.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=6warwewmsa

text.text: Explain Accounting periods reporting.

text: ZOLL Billing automatically records all posted charges, payments, and adjustments to the appropriate monthly accounting period. Managers can use the information in the accounting periods to reconcile billing charges, transactions, and adjustments with monthly closing reports.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=8om2h8e9c2

text.text: What is Accounting periods reporting?

text: ZOLL Billing automatically records all posted charges, payments, and adjustments to the appropriate monthly accounting period. Managers can use the information in the accounting periods to reconcile billing charges, transactions, and adjustments with monthly closing reports. The charges, payments, and adjustments are in flux until you close the period; once closed, you cannot make modifications to that period. To get started, click Accounting Periods on the navigation bar.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=8om2h8e9c2

text.text: How to report accounting periods?

text: There are four reports available for closed periods that you can access by clicking "Download reports". A zip file opens with three .csv files that shows adjustments, charts, and payments. In addition, you will see an accounting period summary report that provides information on: * the payer * the number of claims * the billing charged amount * contractual allowances * net charges * payments * revenue adjustments * write-offs * refunds * balance * net charges per claim
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=8om2h8e9c2

text.text: How to add a prior authorization number to existing claims?

text: To enter a prior authorization for an existing claim, go to the Claim page > COB tab. If existing payer authorizations were created for the same patient and payer on other claims, and the service date of the current claim falls within the effective and expiration date range of the existing authorization, the authorization(s) display. Click Assign to apply them to your current claim.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=usvcjwlium

text.text: automated clearing house payment acquisitions

text: Automated Clearing House Payment Acquisitions are payments that are automatically downloaded to ZOLL Billing in a nightly transmission.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=r4r2xrylti

text.text: What is automated clearing house payment acquisitions?

text: Automated Clearing House Payment Acquisitions are payments that are automatically downloaded to ZOLL Billing in a nightly transmission.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=r4r2xrylti

text.text: How can I automate clearing house payment acquisitions?

text: Once the sFTP connection is established, Waystar will automatically download your remit files to ZOLL Billing in a nightly transmission. The imported files will appear in the morning in your Current tab on the Payments page. They will be easy to locate - their deposit date shows as "TBD".
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=r4r2xrylti

text.text: Select next payer while posting?

text: The feature lets you decide who the next payer is in the coordination of benefits.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=kff0eeb7cf

text.text: How do I select next payer while posting?

text: To select next payer while posting, you can click on the deposit date of the 835. This feature lets you decide who the next payer is in the coordination of benefits.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=kff0eeb7cf

text.text: reversal and refund

text: To reverse a refund, you must first reverse the refund on the Claim page and then reverse the transaction. You can reverse a transaction because of insufficient funds, stopped payment, or if it was posted in error. The entire transaction will reverse, this includes every single line item in the transaction.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=lmj5pdrwn6

text.text: How to post a revenue adjustment?

text: To post a revenue adjustment, you can follow these steps: 1. Go to the Claim page by entering the claim number in the search field and clicking the claim number in the search results. 2. On the Claim page, click the Credits tab. 3. On the top, right side of the credit block containing the revenue adjustment information, click the Reverse adjustment link. 4. On the confirmation window, click Reverse adjustment.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=2xmmna6n1x

text.text: How can I post revenue adjustments?

text: To post a revenue adjustment, you can follow these steps: 1. On the Claim page, click the Credits tab and then the Adjust balance button. 2. When the "Adjust balance" window opens, click Revenue adjustment, click the Description field and choose a description from the list, and then enter the adjustment amount for each HCPCS. 3. The new balance will display at the bottom of the window. Click Post now.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=2xmmna6n1x

text.text: I want to post revenue adjustment.

text: To post a revenue adjustment, you can follow these steps: 1. On the Claim page, click the Credits tab and then the Adjust balance button. 2. When the "Adjust balance" window opens, click Revenue adjustment, click the Description field and choose a description from the list, and then enter the adjustment amount for each HCPCS. 3. The new balance will display at the bottom of the window. Click Post now. You can view the revenue adjustment in the Credits, Running Claim Balance, and Running Charge Balance tabs on the Claim page.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=2xmmna6n1x

text.text: Process a refund?

text: To process a refund, you can follow these steps: 1. Enter the claim number in the search field 2. On the search results, click the claim number 3. On the Claim page, click the Credits tab 4. Click Refund payment 5. In the dialog box: Partial refund: a. Click the edit icon next to the transaction amount b. Enter the amount for each HICPC c. Enter the transaction type, number, and date Full refund: a. Leave the amount alone b. Enter the amount for each HICPC c. Enter the transaction type, number, and date 6. Click Post now
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xa6yc8w4ox

text.text: How to process a refund?

text: To process a refund, you can follow these steps: 1. Enter the claim number in the search field 2. On the search results, click the claim number 3. On the Claim page, click the Credits tab 4. Click Refund payment 5. In the dialog box: Partial refund: a. Click the edit icon next to the transaction amount b. Enter the amount for each HICPC c. Enter the transaction type, number, and date Full refund: a. Leave the amount alone b. Enter the amount for each HICPC c. Enter the transaction type, number, and date 6. Click Post now
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xa6yc8w4ox

text.text: Explain processing a refund.

text: To process a refund, you can follow these steps: 1. Enter the claim number in the search field 2. On the search results, click the claim number 3. On the Claim page, click the Credits tab 4. On the credit block that displays the refund, click Reverse refund 5. Click Refund payment 6. You will see a credit block with the original refund and then another with the reversal
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xa6yc8w4ox
